snippet: China’s central bank announced interest rate reforms, removing minimum rates banks may charge for loans in a step toward more market-driven credit pricing.
abstract: China steps up its effort to restructure it weakening economy by lifting some controls over bank lending rates; its central bank removes minimum rates banks may charge for loans in a step toward more market-driven credit pricing.
lead_paragraph: China’s central bank announced interest rate reforms, removing minimum rates banks may charge for loans in a step toward more market-driven credit pricing.

headline.main: China Eases Bank Loan Rules, in a Step Toward a Market-Driven Economy
headline.print_headline: China Eases Bank Loan Rules, in a Step Toward a Market-Driven Economy
